posts.title: How to make this site
posts.text: hexo cheatsheet install hexo with npm https://coldnew.github.io/hexo-org-example/2017/03/05/getting-started-with-hexo-and-org-mode/ npm install -g hexo-cli create a new blog / site https://coldnew.github.io/hexo-org-example/2017/03/05/getting-started-with-hexo-and-org-mode/ This creates a new folder for the site, and then goes to that folder: hexo init my-blog && cd my-blog Alternatively, if you do not name a folder, the site is installed in the current folder: mkdir my_new_blog cd my_new_blog hexo init Install org renderer for hexo https://coldnew.github.io/hexo-org-example/2017/03/05/getting-started-with-hexo-and-org-mode/ npm install https://github.com/coldnew/hexo-renderer-org#coldnew --save config your site to use org-mode hexo renderer https://coldnew.github.io/hexo-org-example/2017/03/05/getting-started-with-hexo-and-org-mode/ Add this to _config.yml: # hexo-renderer-org ## Docs: https://github.com/coldnew/hexo-render-org org: emacs: /Applications/Emacs.app/Contents/MacOS/Emacs emacsclient: /Applications/Emacs.app/Contents/MacOS/bin/emacsclient cachedir: ./hexo-org-cache/ theme: tango-dark common: | #+OPTIONS: html-postamble:nil add htmlize highlighting (coloring) for code https://coldnew.github.io/hexo-org-example/2017/03/05/getting-started-with-hexo-and-org-mode/ Add the following option to the above org: key-group (see previous section) org: # to make hexo-renderer-org htmlize content, this should set false htmlize: true starting the server on a project From inside the project's folder, run this: hexo server --draft --open This starts the server with a few extra options: –draft: Enable viwable draft posts (by default, drafts are hidden) –open: Open the local site in your browser A browser should pop up and display the default blog site with a canned "Hello World" post. Install hexo-browsersync for automatic sync of edited pages npm install hexo-browsersync --save hexo server --draft --open # restart the server generate the blog pages for publishing to web hexo generate # generates -> ./public/ Use the extra flag/option --watch to generate pages anew as they are edited: hexo generate --watch deploy hexo pages on github-pages https://gist.github.com/btfak/18938572f5df000ebe06fbd1872e4e39 Yaml configuration for site name + theming path general site config: title, url, root etc # Site title: yt8yt's note subtitle: description: yt8yt's personal blog author: yt8yt language: timezone: Japan # URL ## If your site is put in a subdirectory, set url as 'http://yoursite.com/child' and root as '/child/' url: http://yt8yt.github.io/ root: / permalink: :year/:month/:day/:title/ permalink_defaults: NOTE: make sure to add the name of your repo to the root: key's path, if this is not your personal page but one that runs under a repo different than your users' name on github! config git repo for deployment # Deployment ## Docs: http://hexo.io/docs/deployment.html deploy: type: git repo: git@github.com:yt8yt/yt8yt.github.io.git branch: gh-pages NOTE: gh-pages is important! install github deployer plugin npm install hexo-deployer-git --save deploying with deploy hexo deploy cleaning up published files in case of doubt hexo clean Removes published files. You may have to run: hexo generate to re-generate the published files, before deploying. how to add an "about" page and link it to the main menu create pages (instead of posts) (for linking to menu items) http://stackoverflow.com/questions/29167023/how-to-add-route-for-hexo answer 1 You have to create a new page by runnning hexo new page "about". A folder will be created in source/. In this folder, there is a file named index.md. In this file, you can write the content of this page /about in markdown. This page will be displayed as a post page layout, if you want an other layout and style, define in front-matter, the layout with layout: YOURLAYOUT. Of course, you have to create this layout in the layout folder of your theme folder. The layout name will be the name of the file. answer 2 (includes instructions for menu item in theme) If you need a page about : run hexo new page "about" You will find an about folder in the source folder. You can edit the index.md file in the about folder. add code About: /about in the menu section of _config.yml file in your theme folder. Preview your site :) themes: lists and choices hexo themes home page + gallery https://hexo.io/themes/ current (DEFINITE!) first choice: hipaper https://itimetraveler.github.io/hexo-theme-hipaper/ https://github.com/iTimeTraveler/hexo-theme-hipaper Hiero is very similar, and an alternative, but I prefer the cleaner look of hipaper. https://itimetraveler.github.io/hexo-theme-hiero/ https://github.com/iTimeTraveler/hexo-theme-hiero clean look, white, no hero picture on top resonsive, mobile compatible simple sans font great sidebar widget functionality: You can put your sidebar in left side, right side or bottom of your site by editing sidebar setting. Hiero provides 7 built-in widgets: search social recentposts category tag tagcloud archive includes plugin for fast search, independent of third-party apps. Hiero use Insight Search to help you search anything inside your site without any third-party plugin. includes plugin for fancybox to present picture galleries in various ways. Hiero uses Fancybox to showcase your photos. You can use Markdown syntax or fancybox tag plugin to add your photos. disqus support for comments Important: Contents are displayed in the sidebar! This enables long documents from org-mode. (!? to test…) older first choice: blue lake https://github.com/chaooo/hexo-theme-BlueLake/blob/master/README.en.md responsive mobile-ready config example with menu for different pages/folders perhaps even better? ylion/geekaholic https://github.com/GeekaholicLin/hexo-theme-ylion http://blog.geekaholic.cn/ another candidate: maupassant https://github.com/tufu9441/maupassant-hexo Author: IOANNIS ZANNOS Created: 2017-05-06 Sat 13:24 Validate

posts.title: Code rendering test
posts.text: Testing how hexo / hipaper renders supercollider code. //: record test buffer with an ascending sine wave. { var sound; Server.default.prepareForRecord; 0.1.wait; { SinOsc.ar (Line.kr (300, 3000, 3), 0, 0.1) }.play; 0.1.wait; Server.default.record; 1.wait; Server.default.stopRecording; "done".postln; }.fork; Author: IOANNIS ZANNOS Created: 2017-05-06 Sat 13:15 Validate

posts.title: Hello World
posts.text: Welcome to Hexo! This is your very first post. Check documentation for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in troubleshooting or you can ask me on GitHub. Quick StartCreate a new post1$ hexo new "My New Post" More info: Writing Run server1$ hexo server More info: Server Generate static files1$ hexo generate More info: Generating Deploy to remote sites1$ hexo deploy More info: Deployment
